message.content:
We first identify the numbers needed from the three statements.

1. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio  
• From the balance sheet, Accounts Receivable:  
 – Initial: 0.00  
 – End: 2,117,339.65  
 Average Accounts Receivable = (0 + 2,117,339.65) / 2 = 1,058,669.825  
• From the income statement, Main Business Revenue = 2,637,011.03  
• Therefore, Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio = 2,637,011.03 / 1,058,669.825 ≈ 2.49  

2. Operating Cash Flow Ratio  
• From the cash flow statement, Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –1,028,375.55  
• From the balance sheet, Total Current Liabilities = 378,850.51  
• Thus, Operating Cash Flow Ratio = –1,028,375.55 / 378,850.51 ≈ –2.71  

3. Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio  
• This ratio is computed by the same formula as above so it is also –2.71  

4. Total Asset Turnover Ratio  
• Total Assets are given on the balance sheet:  
 – Initial: 13,000,000.00  
 – End: 14,214,117.02  
 Average Total Assets = (13,000,000.00 + 14,214,117.02) / 2 = 13,607,058.51  
• Using Main Business Revenue = 2,637,011.03,  
 Total Asset Turnover Ratio = 2,637,011.03 / 13,607,058.51 ≈ 0.19  

5. Debt to Equity Ratio  
• Liabilities are shown as Current Liabilities = 378,850.51 (there are no other liabilities provided)  
• Total Owner’s Equity (from the balance sheet) = 13,835,266.51  
 Debt to Equity Ratio = 378,850.51 / 13,835,266.51 ≈ 0.03  

Thus, our computed ratios with appropriate rounding are:  

{
  "solution": {
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "2.49",
    "operating cash flow ratio": "-2.71",
    "operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio": "-2.71",
    "Total Asset Turnover Ratio": "0.19",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.03"
  }
}
